title: Speaker National Assembly leaves for Lahore via train on three-day official visit
content:
RAWALPINDI, Jun 05 (APP):Speaker National Assembly Asad Qaiser on Saturday left for Lahore on a three-day official visit by Green Line train.
Member National Assembly, Junaid Akbar and Senator Ayub Afridi also accompanied him.
Asad Qaiser along with a three-member delegation boarded the Green Line train from Chaklala Railway Station.
Divisional Superintendent Rawalpindi Inamullah Mehsud and Divisional Commercial Officer, Mian Fazal Elahi along with other officers of Pakistan Railways were present at the railway station.
Inamullah Mehsud while talking to APP here said train operations were being carried out following Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), adding, provision of sanitizers and masks was ensured to the passengers during the journey while any passenger without masks was not allowed to board the train.
He said the travel of important personalities via train was a manifestation of the standard travel facilities provided to the passengers by the Pakistan Railways.
